00043 /*! A class to hold a MIME value 
00044  *  Is responsible for managing the memory for the mime value
00045  */
00046 class MIMEValue
00047 {
00048 public:
00049         /*! Constructs a MIME value - default constructor */
00050         MIMEValue();
00051 
00052         /*! Constructs a MIME value
00053          *      @param value A pointer to array containing the MIME encoded value
00054          *      @param size The size of the array
00055          */
00056         MIMEValue(const void* value, u_int32_t size);
00057 
00058         /*! Copy constructor
00059          *      @param source MIMEValue object to copy
00060          */
00061         MIMEValue(const MIMEValue& source);
00062 
00063         /*! Destructor */
00064         ~MIMEValue();
00065 
00066         /*! Assignment operator
00067          * @param source The source.
00068          * @return The copied object.
00069          */
00070         MIMEValue& operator=(const MIMEValue& source);
00071 
00072         /*! Operator equals
00073          * @param lhs The left hand side to compare.
00074          * @return True if the same.
00075          */
00076         bool operator==(const MIMEValue& lhs);
00077 
00078         /*! Operator not equals.
00079          * @param lhs The let hand side to compare.
00080          * @return True if not equal.
00081          */
00082         bool operator!=(const MIMEValue& lhs);
00083 
00084         /*! Set the controlled value
00085          *      @param value A pointer to array containing the MIME encoded value
00086          *      @param size The size of the array
00087          */
00088         void SetValue(const void* value, u_int32_t size);
00089 
00090         /*! Get the controlled value
00091          *      @param size Gets filled with the size of the constrolled array
00092          *      @ return Const pointer to the MIME value array. (for writing)*/
00093         const void* GetValue(u_int32_t& size) const;
00094 
00095         /*! Gets the size of the array */
00096         u_int32_t Size() const { return arrSize; }
00097 
00098 private:
00099         /*! The buffer to hold the data. */
00100         char* arr;
00101 
00102         /*! The size of the buffer. */
00103         u_int32_t arrSize;
00104 };
00105 
00106 /*! A class to hold a parameter name/value/type.
00107  *      This class will convert several built-in types between the MIME string and their native types.
00108  */
00109 class ParameterNameValueType
00110 {
00111 public:
00112         /*! Default constructor */
00113         ParameterNameValueType() {}
00114 
00115         /*! MIME constructor.  Useful when reading in from a file 
00116          *      @param name Parameter name
00117          *      @param mimeValue MIME encoded value in a buffer
00118          *      @param mimeValueSize The size in bytes of the MIME encoded value.
00119          *      @param mimeType 
00120          */
00121         ParameterNameValueType(const std::wstring& name, const void* mimeValue, int32_t mimeValueSize, const std::wstring& mimeType);
00122 
00123         /*! MIME constructor.  Useful when reading in from a file 
00124          *      @param name Parameter name
00125          *      @param mimeValue MIME encoded value
00126          *      @param mimeType 
00127          */
00128         ParameterNameValueType(const std::wstring& name, const MIMEValue& mimeValue, const std::wstring& mimeType);
00129 
00130         // Default copy constructor is fine
00131 
00132         /*! A copy operator.
00133          *      @param param The parameter to copy.
00134          */
00135         ParameterNameValueType operator=(const ParameterNameValueType& param) { Name = param.Name; Value = param.Value; Type = param.Type; return *this; }
00136 
00137         /*! An equality operator. Compares the parameter name.
00138          *      @param param The parameter to compare.
00139          *      @return True if the parameter names are the same.
00140          */
00141         bool operator==(const ParameterNameValueType& param) const { if (param.Name == Name) return true; return false; }
00142         
00143         /*! An inequality operator.  Compares the parameter name.
00144          *      @param param The parameter to compare.
00145          *      @return True if the parameter names are different.
00146          */
00147         bool operator!=(const ParameterNameValueType& param) const { if (param.Name == Name) return false; return true; }
00148 
00149         /*! An equality operator. Compares the parameter name.
00150          *      @param name A parameter name to compare.
00151          *      @return True if the parameter names are the same.
00152          */
00153         bool operator==(const std::wstring &name) const { if (Name == name) return true; return false; }
00154         
00155         /*! An inequality operator.  Compares the parameter name.
00156          *      @param name A parameter name to compare.
00157          *      @return True if the parameter names are diffenent.
00158          */
00159         bool operator!=(const std::wstring &name) const { if (Name == name) return false; return true; }
00160 
00161         /*! Less than comparison operator.  Compares the parameter name.
00162          *      @param param The parameter to compare.
00163          *      @return True if the target parameter name is lexically less than param.
00164         */
00165         bool operator<(const ParameterNameValueType &param) const { return (Name < param.Name); }
00166         /*! Greater than comparison operator.  Compares the parameter name.
00167          *      @param param The parameter to compare.
00168          *      @return True if the target parameter name is lexically greter than param.
00169         */
00170         bool operator>(const ParameterNameValueType &param) const { return (Name > param.Name); }
00171 
00172         /*! Get the name of the parameter
00173          *      @ Name of the parameter
00174          */
00175         std::wstring GetName() const { return Name; }
00176 
00177         /*! Set the name of the parameter.
00178          *      @param value Name of the parameter.
00179          */
00180         void SetName(const std::wstring& value) { Name = value; }
00181         
00182         /*! Enumerant of the built-in parameter types. */
00183         enum ParameterType { 
00184                           Int8Type,                     /*! an 8 bit integer. */
00185                           UInt8Type,            /*! an 8 bit unsigned integer. */
00186                           Int16Type,            /*! a 16 bit integer. */
00187                           UInt16Type,           /*! a 16 bit unsigned integer. */
00188                           Int32Type,            /*! a 32 bit integer. */
00189                           UInt32Type,           /*! a 32 bit unsigned integer. */
00190                           FloatType,            /*! a 32 bit floating point. */
00191                           TextType,                     /*! a 16 bit character. */
00192                           AsciiType,            /*! an 8 bit character. */
00193                           UnknownType           /*! an 8 bit integer. */
00194         };
00195                           
00196         /*! Get the parameter type
00197          *      @return The parameter type of the object.*/
00198         ParameterType GetParameterType() const;
00199         
00200         /*! Gets value as a int8_t
00201          *      @return Value of the parameter as an int8_t
00202          *      @exception affymetrix_calvin_exceptions::ParameterMismatchException Parameter is not an int8_t
00203          */
00204         int8_t GetValueInt8() const;
00205 
00206         /*! Sets the value as an int8_t
00207          *      @param value
00208          */
00209         void SetValueInt8(int8_t value);
00210 
00211         /*! Gets value as a u_int8_t
00212          *      @return Value of the parameter as an u_int8_t
00213          *      @exception affymetrix_calvin_exceptions::ParameterMismatchException Parameter is not a u_int8_t
00214          */
00215         u_int8_t GetValueUInt8() const;
00216 
00217         /*! Sets the value as a u_int8_t
00218          *      @param value
00219          */
00220         void SetValueUInt8(u_int8_t value);
00221 
00222         /*! Gets value as a int16_t
00223          *      @return Value of the parameter as an int16_t
00224          *      @exception affymetrix_calvin_exceptions::ParameterMismatchException Parameter is not an int16_t
00225          */
00226         int16_t GetValueInt16() const;
00227 
00228         /*! Sets the value as an int16_t
00229          *      @param value
00230          */
00231         void SetValueInt16(int16_t value);
00232 
00233         /*! Gets value as a u_int16_t
00234          *      @return Value of the parameter as an u_int16_t
00235          *      @exception affymetrix_calvin_exceptions::ParameterMismatchException Parameter is not a u_int16_t
00236          */
00237         u_int16_t GetValueUInt16() const;
00238 
00239         /*! Sets the value as a u_int16_t
00240          *      @param value
00241          */
00242         void SetValueUInt16(u_int16_t value);
00243 
00244         /*! Gets value as a int32_t
00245          *      @return Value of the parameter as an int32_t
00246          *      @exception affymetrix_calvin_exceptions::ParameterMismatchException Parameter is not an int32_t
00247          */
00248         int32_t GetValueInt32() const;
00249 
00250         /*! Sets the value as an int32_t
00251          *      @param value
00252          */
00253         void SetValueInt32(int32_t value);
00254 
00255         /*! Gets value as a u_int32_t
00256          *      @return Value of the parameter as an u_int32_t
00257          *      @exception affymetrix_calvin_exceptions::ParameterMismatchException Parameter is not a u_int32_t
00258          */
00259         u_int32_t GetValueUInt32() const;
00260 
00261         /*! Sets the value as a u_int32_t
00262          *      @param value
00263          */
00264         void SetValueUInt32(u_int32_t value);
00265 
00266         /*! Gets value as a float
00267          *      @return Value of the parameter as an float
00268          *      @exception affymetrix_calvin_exceptions::ParameterMismatchException Parameter is not a float
00269          */
00270         float GetValueFloat() const;
00271 
00272         /*! Sets the value as a float
00273          *      @param value
00274          */
00275         void SetValueFloat(float value);
00276 
00277         /*! Gets value as a wstring
00278          *      @return Value of the parameter as an wstring
00279          *      @exception affymetrix_calvin_exceptions::ParameterMismatchException Parameter is not a text type
00280          */
00281         std::wstring GetValueText() const;
00282 
00283         /*! Sets the value as a text type.
00284          *      @param value String representation of the value.
00285          *      @param reserve The total number of characters to reserve for the value. -1 indicates not to reserve any extra space.
00286          */
00287         void SetValueText(const std::wstring &value, int32_t reserve = -1);
00288 
00289         /*! Gets value as a string
00290          *      @return Value of the parameter as an string
00291          *      @exception affymetrix_calvin_exceptions::ParameterMismatchException Parameter is not a text type
00292          */
00293         std::string GetValueAscii() const;
00294 
00295         /*! Sets the value as a text type.
00296          *      @param value String representation of the value.
00297          *      @param reserve The total number of characters to reserve for the value. -1 indicates not to reserve any extra space.
00298          */
00299         void SetValueAscii(const std::string &value, int32_t reserve = -1);
00300         
00301         // Raw MIME methods
00302         /*! Returns the mime type without interpretation.
00303          *      @return String of the MIME type
00304          */
00305         std::wstring GetMIMEType() const { return Type; }
00306 
00307         /*! Sets the mime type without attempting to interpret it.
00308          *      @param value
00309          */
00310         void SetMIMEType(const std::wstring& value) { Type = value; }
00311 
00312         /*! Returns the mime value without interpretation.
00313          *      @return MIME encoded string.
00314          */
00315         MIMEValue GetMIMEValue() const { return Value; }
00316 
00317         /*! Sets the mime value without attempting to interpret it.
00318          *      @param value MIME encoded string.
00319          */
00320         void SetMIMEValue(const MIMEValue& value) { Value = value; }
00321 
00322         /*! Converts the value of known types to a string
00323          *      @return A string representation of the value
00324          */
00325         std::wstring ToString() const;
00326 
00327 protected:
00328         /*! Converts a value to an integer.
00329          * @param mimeType The string representation.
00330          * @return The integer representation.
00331          */
00332         u_int32_t ValueToInt(const wchar_t* mimeType) const;
00333 
00334         /*! Converts an integer to a value.
00335          * @param value The integer representation.
00336          * @param type The string representation.
00337          */
00338         void IntToValue(u_int32_t value, const wchar_t* type);
00339 
00340 protected:
00341         /*! The name of the parameter */
00342         std::wstring Name;
00343 
00344         /*! The MIME type of the parameter */
00345         std::wstring Type;
00346 
00347         /*! The MIME value of the parameter */
00348         MIMEValue Value;
00349 };

00363 /*! A class to hold a name/value/type/default/required attributes. */
00364 class ParameterNameValueDefaultRequiredType : public ParameterNameValueType
00365 {
00366 public:
00367         /*! The type of value. */
00368         enum ParameterValueType
00369         {
00370                 NoParameterType,                /*! Not set. */
00371                 IntegerParameterType,   /*! Integer stored in the MIME value. */
00372                 FloatParameterType,             /*! Floating point stored in the MIME value. */
00373                 TextParameterType,              /*! Text stored in the MIME value. */
00374                 DateParameterType,              /*! Date stored in the MIME value as text. */
00375                 TimeParameterType,              /*! Time stored in the MIME value as text. */
00376                 DateTimeParameterType,  /*! DateTime stored in the MIME value as text. */
00377                 ControlSingleParameterType,     /*! Controlled single selection stored in the MIME value as text. */
00378                 ControlMultiParameterType       /*! Controlled multi selection stored in the controlMulti list. */
00379         };
00380 
00381         /*! Converts the type to a string.
00382          * @param value The type.
00383          * @return The string representation.
00384          */
00385         static std::wstring ParameterValueTypeToString(ParameterValueType value);
00386 
00387         /*! Converts the string to a type.
00388          * @param value The string representation.
00389          * @return The type.
00390          */
00391         static ParameterValueType ParameterValueTypeFromString(const std::wstring &value);
00392 
00393 protected:
00394         /*! The MIME value of the default parameter */
00395         MIMEValue defaultValue;
00396 
00397         /*! A flag to indicate if a default exist. */
00398         bool hasDefault;
00399 
00400         /*! A flag to indicate if the parameter is required. */
00401         bool required;
00402 
00403         /*! A list of parameter values for controlled vocabulary. */
00404         std::list<std::wstring> controlled;
00405 
00406         /*! A list of multi-selected controlled values. */
00407         std::list<std::wstring> controlMultiValues;
00408 
00409         /*! The type of value stored. */
00410         ParameterValueType valueType;
00411 
00412         /*! Converts a value to an integer.
00413          * @param mimeType The string representation.
00414          * @return The integer representation.
00415          */
00416         u_int32_t DefaultValueToInt(const wchar_t* mimeType) const;
00417 
00418         /*! Converts an integer to a value.
00419          * @param value The integer representation.
00420          * @param type The string representation.
00421          */
00422         void IntToDefaultValue(u_int32_t value, const wchar_t* type);
00423 
00424         /*! Sets the parameter type. */
00425         void SetParameterType();
00426 
00427 public:
00428         
00429         /*! A list of multi-selected controlled values.
00430          * @return The multi-selected controlled values.
00431          */
00432         std::list<std::wstring> &ControlMultiValues() { return controlMultiValues; }
00433 
00434         /*! The type of value stored. */
00435         ParameterValueType &ValueType() { return valueType; }
00436 
00437         /*! A list of parameter values for controlled vocabulary.
00438          * @return The list of parameter values for controlled vocabulary.
00439          */
00440         std::list<std::wstring> &ControlledVocabulary() { return controlled; }
00441 
00442         /*! Returns the mime value without interpretation.
00443          *      @return MIME encoded string.
00444          */
00445         MIMEValue &DefaultMIMEValue() { return defaultValue; }
00446 
00447         /*! Gets the required flag.
00448          * @return The required flag.
00449          */
00450         bool &RequiredFlag() { return required; }
00451 
00452         /*! A flag to indicate if a default exist.
00453          * @return The flag indicating if a default value exists.
00454          */
00455         bool &HasDefault() { return hasDefault; }
00456 
00457         /*! Default constructor */
00458         ParameterNameValueDefaultRequiredType() { required = false; hasDefault = false; valueType = NoParameterType; }
00459 
00460         /*! MIME constructor.  Useful when reading in from a file 
00461          *      @param name Parameter name
00462          *      @param mimeValue MIME encoded value in a buffer
00463          *      @param mimeValueSize The size in bytes of the MIME encoded value.
00464          *      @param mimeType The MIME type.
00465          *  @param defaultMimeValue The default MIME encoded value in a buffer.
00466          *  @param defaultMimeValueSize The size in bytes of the default MIME encoded value.
00467          *  @param req Flag to indicate if the parameter is required.
00468          */
00469         ParameterNameValueDefaultRequiredType(const std::wstring& name, const void* mimeValue, int32_t mimeValueSize, const std::wstring& mimeType, const void *defaultMimeValue, int32_t defaultMimeValueSize, bool req);
00470 
00471         /*! MIME constructor.  Useful when reading in from a file
